children.text: As you approach the painting, the figure of the soldier trapped inside seems motionless, frozen in time. But as you gaze at the painting, something strange begins to happen. At first, it's just a flicker of movement, barely perceptible. But then, the scene starts to come to life. The soldier begins to move, struggling against invisible bonds, his face contorted with fear and pain. As you watch, the scene becomes more and more gruesome. Blood spatters the walls of the painting, and the soldier's face contorts in agony as a ragged spear skewers its body. It's a terrifying sight, and you feel a deep sense of unease as you watch. But just as suddenly as it began, the scene comes to an abrupt end. The painting returns to its still state, the soldier once again frozen in time. You're left standing there, shaken by the experience. The power of the spell that trapped the soldier inside the painting is evident, and you can't help but wonder what other horrors might be lurking inside the walls of the mansion.

children.choiceLabel: Make a note of the painting and leave.

children.text: You approach the painting of the hooded figure and as you look closer, you notice something strange happening. At first, it's just a flicker of movement, barely perceptible. But then, the scene starts to come to life. The thief's body begins to move, and you can see them struggling with something just out of view. It's clear they are trying to enter a vault, but something has gone terribly wrong. As you watch, the scene becomes more and more frantic. The thief's body twists and turns, sweat pouring down their face as they try to escape whatever has trapped him inside the painting. But it's no use. With a final gasp, the thief slumps to the ground, their body still as the spell takes them. The painting returns to its still state, the thief once again frozen in time. You're left standing there, a sense of dread settling in your stomach. If the count and countess are capable of this kind of magic, what other dark secrets might be hidden inside the walls of their mansion?

You turn your attention to the painting of the merchant, wondering if it too will come to life like the others. As you stare at it intently, the figure in the painting seems to shift and move. At first, it's just a slight tremble of the body, but soon the painting begins to glow with an eerie light. Suddenly, the merchant's figure steps out of the painting and onto the floor, looking around in confusion. "Excuse me, is this the Vesparin mansion?" he asks, turning towards you. But before you can answer, the figure of the merchant suddenly freezes in place. A strange energy crackles in the air, and you realize with a sinking feeling that the count or countess must have cast their magic at that moment. The merchant's body slowly begins to sink back into the painting, his face returning to the confused expression as caught in the painting once more. Within moments, the painting returns to its still state, the merchant once again trapped inside. You can't help but feel a sense of unease as you consider what kind of power the count and countess possess.

rootNode.text: You notice an abandoned backpack leaning against a tree. It appears well-made but weathered, as if it has traveled far. Oddly, no tracks lead to or from it, and a faint shimmer in the air around it catches your eye when you look away. As you approach, an unnatural silence falls. Even the ambient sounds of your surroundings seem muted, as if something is holding its breath, watching.

children.text: The backpack is made of fine leather, stained with a dark substance. Opening it reveals surprisingly dry contents: a leather-bound journal and brass locket.

The journal belongs to someone named Elias Hilt. The early entries document a conventional archaeological expedition, but soon descend into increasingly disturbed ramblings about "entities that watch from angles that shouldn't exist" and "whispers that come when I close my eyes." The final entries are written in a cramped, desperate hand: "They exist in the spaces between thoughts. They promised knowledge, but such wisdom was never meant for mortal minds. The stars have shifted. They are coming. I can feel them taking pieces of me when I sleep." The writing trails off into meaningless scribbles that somehow hurt your eyes to look at directly.

As you shut the journal, a rune appears above the book. It glows for a brief moment before attaching itself to one of your cards. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehow—deeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

Focusing your intellect, you manage to comprehend the seemingly random scrawls. Understanding blooms in your mind like a dark flower. The passage describes entities that exist between dimensions—beings that feed on reality itself. Thorne apparently discovered how to close the door he had inadvertently opened, but was too late to save himself. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehow—deeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

The brass locket contains a daguerreotype portrait of a severe-looking man in academic robes. As you study it, you realize with growing unease that the subject's eyes seem to be following your movements. The longer you stare, the more the background behind the figure appears to deepen, revealing impossible geometries and a vast darkness populated by distant, watching entities.

You snap the locket shut, a cold sweat breaking across your brow. For a moment, you could swear you heard it whisper your name. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehow—deeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

You find yourself unable to look away. The portrait's reality begins to bleed into yours—or perhaps it's the other way around. The boundary between image and observer grows thin. "WE HAVE BEEN WAITING FOR SO LONG." comes a voice from everywhere and nowhere at once. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehow—deeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

Among the belongings, you find a small wooden box containing star charts with unfamiliar constellations, specimens preserved in cloudy fluid, and what appears to be correspondence written in cipher. Hidden in a secret compartment of the box, you discover something truly valuable. You find 15 gold! As your fingers touch the gold, the air around you grows dense, and a voice that seems to come from inside your own head whispers: "A fair exchange. We have marked you now." The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehow—deeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

children.choiceLabel: Attempt to communicate with the presence

children.text: Drawing on your disciplined mind, you attempt to communicate with whatever presence lingers around the backpack. For a moment, nothing happens. Then, like a door opening in your mind, contact is established. What floods through is not language as you understand it, but pure concept—vast and ancient and utterly alien. "WE ARE THE TIDE THAT RISES BETWEEN UNIVERSES. WE ARE THE EYES THAT WATCH FROM ANGLES UNDREAMT. WE HAVE TASTED YOUR REALITY AND FOUND IT... SUITABLE." Images flash through your mind: stars going dark one by one; a city of impossible architecture beneath an ocean of liquid darkness; beings of immense size moving through void; and finally, yourself—but changed, serving as a doorway for something to enter your world.

You force the presence out of your mind. The backlash is immediate and painful, but you sense you've earned a reluctant respect from whatever contacted you. "STRONG VESSEL. WORTHY RESISTANCE. WE WILL WATCH YOU." You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You mentally form a question about their purpose. The answer comes not in words but in sensations—hunger, desire, inevitability. They seek transformation. They seek to remake your reality in their image.

Something tells you that taking any of these items would be a grave mistake. You back away from the backpack, leaving everything untouched. As you turn to leave, the air shimmers violently around the abandoned pack. For just a moment, you glimpse something impossible—a tear in reality itself, through which gaze eyes of many sizes and shapes, all fixed on you. A splitting headache strikes you, but with it comes a fragment of knowledge you shouldn't possess.

You stand perfectly still, listening to the silence. But it isn't silent at all. Beneath the threshold of normal hearing, there's a persistent, rhythmic sound—like breathing, but not quite. Like whispers, but without words. The sound seems to come from inside the backpack. No—from inside your own thoughts.

It doesn't help. The sounds continue unabated, suggesting they never came from outside at all. "Vessel," something seems to say, though you hear it with your mind rather than your ears. "Soon." When you lower your hands, you find a strange coin in your palm that wasn't there before. You find 15 gold! You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

"Kaius-..." the old shaman gasps, the thin reflection of life quickly fading from her eyes before her now dead hand slides back into the cold, bloody snow.

rootNode.text: A woman's pained sobs echo through the area. "Please, help me!" she pleads, her voice trembling. "Bandits attacked my caravan. They... they took everything and left me here to die." Her gaze is filled with desperate hope.

children.text: You study the woman more carefully, noticing subtle inconsistencies. The restraints seem theatrical rather than functional. Her tears leave no trails and her shadow ripples in a way no human shadow should. "Is something wrong?" she asks, her voice suddenly taking on a honeyed quality. "Please hurry... I'm so frightened."

The woman's expression freezes, then transforms into a wicked smile. The air around her shimmers, and her true form is revealed; a succubus with batlike wings, curved horns, and eyes that glow with unnatural hunger. "Well, aren't you a clever one," she purrs, stretching languidly as if relieved to abandon the pretense. The succubus hovers before you, her wings spread wide, her tail flicking with irritation. "Most mortals would be thrilled by my attentions," she says with a dangerous smile. "But those who do not appriciate the velvet hand of The Abyssal Legion will have to deal with the claws!"

The succubus laughs, a sound like dark bells. "So commanding! I do love that in a mortal." She winks at you, circling overhead. "Very well, I'll find easier prey elsewhere. But remember my face, [[class]]. When the Abyssal Legion marches across these lands, I'll make a special point to find you again." With a final blown kiss that leaves a trace of frost in the air, she vanishes in a swirl of dark mist.
"Pity. We could have had such fun." The succubus's smile fades, replaced by cold determination. "If not pleasure, then pain will have to do."

The succubus considers you with newfound interest. "Curious as well as clever. I like that." She drifts closer, though still maintaining a safe distance. "We serve the will of Dantellion. These lands have something he desires greatly — away from the prying eyes of those that hunt him." She smiles cryptically. "My role is simply to be an ambassador of a kind, not all stoop to violence as quickly as my 'kin'."

Before the music completely takes over your mind, you quickly stab yourself in your arm. A sharp pain goes through your body, but that might be exactly what you need to keep yourself sane. Eventually the music stops. Your self-inflicted wound hurts, but at least your mind is still your own.

The music of the imps is much louder than the song you were hearing before. They keep going for a very long time, but at least your mind is unaffected.

rootNode.text: Amidst the black vines and ghostly glow of deadly plant life stands a statue of an angel. Thick vines are wrapped around its limbs but they do not diminish the pride the sculptor wanted to eternalize in the dark stone itself. As you admire the statue, it suddenly twists its head into an unnatural angle. "Greetings, [[relation]]. It's been a while. I'm glad you've made it this far once more, I've started to look forward to our little... entanglements."

children.text: "You wound me, [[relation]]. Don't you recognize me? I am your progenitor. But you can call me Ilthar, the first among many to call this beautiful place a home." "Or at least, I was. Until... well. Let’s not bring back those painful memories just yet." the statue cracks a smile and tilts its head. "Now what about you, [[relation]]. What brings you to our little garden once again? Have we upset Mother again? Have you come to tell me I've been bad?"
The statue points up. "Our 'Lady of Mercy', or whatever title she has chosen for herself by now. Old flamy, you know." the statue smiles without mirth.

"Ah yes, that's her. Such modesty - a 'Sungod'. Now - Rae 'the Vengeful', 'the Jealous' or 'the Jailor'. Now, that would be fitting." "I see you've got Mother’s legendary temper! Fine- if it is a confrontation you seek, you shall have it!"
"I see you've got Mother’s legendary temper! Fine- if it is a confrontation you seek, you shall have it!"

"Always so eager to please Mother! But what about what I wanted? Ever spare a thought about what I wanted?" The statue leaps off its pedestal and rises into the air, carried by the thick, thorny vines entwined around its collosal wings, ready to strike at any moment.
"I see you've got Mother’s legendary temper! Fine- if it is a confrontation you seek, you shall have it!"

The statue pauses, reaching for one of the cracks on its shoulder, sickly fleshy ichor pouring from the 'wound' as its narrows its burning eyes. "Fine! I see Mother's fury still burns inside of you! I'll find you once you've unleashed some of that temper on my guests!" the statue snarls, then lifts up into the air and vanishes into the dark canopy above.

Bolgar rubs his bearded chin and looks up. "Ilthar, or at least an image in his liking. A mythical figure, and according to legend, the first angel to abandon Heaven and seek a life amongst mortals." "But - I very much doubt it was him we truly met. That wound, it was bleeding the ichor of Corruption. A most troubling substance, [[class]]. But whoever it is, I doubt we've seen the last of him."
"What? Oh, I'm sorry - I was a little distracted dear. Whoever it was, I hope they come back and introduces himself properly." she adds, waving her hand to her flustered face.

children.text: "Will ye look at that..." Reghar mutters, eyes wide. "Kivos old friend, you deserved better...".

"Aye - I did. My master served under 'im during the War of Horns. And I would 'ave given everything to follow him into the Black Citadel itself. "But I was too young fer soldiering. By the time I was, Kivos had fallen." The grizzled man looks wistfully for a moment, fist clenching around his hammer. And then there's you. Thank ye for indulging an old man, and allowing him a chance to make amends for his past. I dun' know why, but I see much of Kivos in ye, [[class]].

Stalwart was a shining bastion against the demon hordes. With Kivos at the helm it marked the beginning of a new age. Brightcandle or even Great Candor is but a sputtering flame compared to the blazing glory that Stalwart once was.

Now, a wasteland - but it has served as a no mans land between Umbris and the Shattered Realms, making it hard for either side to fall back into all out war. The unliving are an affront to the Lady of Mercy. With a satisfying crunch the horror goes silent once more as it falls forward into the mud.

Even the unliving deserve the Lady's Mercy. You rest your hand atop the battered skull, invoking the light. For a brief moment, the skeleton looks hopeful - before the last remaining life fades from its decomposed body.

You recognize the armor as belonging to the Stillguard. Mercenaries with a strict code of honour, usually guarding a wealthy merchant or ambassador. The many decorations on the oxidised armor suggest this soldier held a high rank within the order.
The skeletal figure seems confused for a moment, then nods solemnly, rising the bony hand to its battered skull before its lifeless body stops moving once more.
You carefully remove the armor from the skeleton, but despite your best efforts the dusty bones collapse as soon as you relieve it of its rusty carapace.

Yes, [[class]]. What else should I call these beings I sense but can not name. Even in my weakened state, I sense their violent, adversarial nature that would rival the primals in power, brimming inside a corrupted shell.

Selandris was once a bright and beautiful star. Its warm and loving glow gave this world its well-earned name: Mea’Nathal. The Garden. An example of life and harmony amidst a swirling tide of chaos. Both nobles turn away in silence, staring out of one of the tall windows of the Vesparin Mansion overlooking the stretching wasteland of Umbris.

You raise your hand, seeking the attention of both nobles. "Why can't we follow the Dawnbringer's lead and momentum, while we bolster our defenses at home with the help of The Stillguard? If the Radiant Crusade is successful in breaking into Umbris, we can funnel new forces to join the Dawnbringer while strengthening our supply lines and fall back position near the border. children.text: In the vastness of space, a star is born. From this fiery ball of gas and dust, planets begin to form. One planet in particular stands out, a paradise world of lush forests and crystal-clear oceans.

Life flourishes on this planet, with a diversity of species and ecosystems unlike any other. From a distance, it shines like a jewel in the darkness of the cosmos, a testament to the wonder and beauty of the universe.

Suddenly, a blazing fireball burst forth, radiating light and warmth across the verdant surface of the planet. This was the birth of the sun, a magnificent star that would illuminate an entire galaxy, casting a warm glow even through the stone surface of the shard.

Viola stares into the shimmering surface of the stone, in aw of the spectacle unfolding itself. "Was that Aethos? It was so... beautiful." she gasps, a sinlge tear welling up in the corner of her eyes.

You see a lush, green landscape stretch out before you. Lush mountains decorated by vibrant flower patches, where animals seem to live in peace. Yet all you sense is a feeling of deep sadness and solitude.

Slowly, the feeling starts to grow into an excited madness. You know what you must do - and you are willing to make the sacrifices required of you. Moments later, darkness starts to evelop the vision, like ink dropping into a clear glass of water...

Viola gasps. "The betrayer..." she murmurs, narrowing her eyes. "The one exception to the divine Mercy of the Goddess." she adds, turning away from the shard. Let us get away from this place. A sudden laughter fills the mines. "Oh! You like this puppet, don't you? Well you can't have it, it is MINE!"

The laughter fades into a chuckle as black smoke fills the area before the demon appears next to the robed human and runs a sharp-nailed finger over the enthralled priestess' cheek. "Why not? Let's have some fun before you become part of my collection too."

"Who? I don't know his name. He didn't seem in the mood for talking with his hair on fire and slashing into my puppets left and right." The demoness pouts. "I lost a lot of good puppets that day."

children.text: With a final strike, the Angel of Wrath pauses, clenching the wound that was starting to bleed a bright gold ichor. "This... wasn't..." the seraph gasps before his form falls to the floor of his prison. Thoughts start to suddenly push into your consciousness, not your own, but not quite foreign either... "Dawncaster..."

Your mind starts to race, you're descending from a deep, blue sky with dizzying speed and land alongside a grand luscious tree. The earth shakes, fires ignite the very air around you as the corrupted denizens of this world flee before your very presence. You know the betrayer is here - you know he shouldn't be. It has fallen on you to end the now mortal life of the being you once called an equal, and purge this abomination of a world from the tapestry of time. The heart of his corruption is not far. You draw your weapon, and are met with equal force. A deadly dance insues, one you can not lose for death holds no dominion over you. Or can you? Your heavenly fury is met with a strange, unfamiliar opposition. A desire to live. To be. It pushes you back, until you feel the betrayer strike a blow that ends your conscious thought for a moment. Expecting your divine reincarnation, you wait. And wait. And wait... As you look up, you see sunlight break through the top windows. Your mind your own once more, you notice the screams of the demons above have died along with their masters. It feels like, for the first time in a long while, you're able to draw a deep, satisfying breath. The old mage steps up behind you, tapping his gnarled staff against the fallen angel. "Impressive, Dawncaster. You've succeeded where many, many others have failed - this world owes you a debt it won't be able to repay you, but such is the fate of heroes." You feel the mage's words ring true, today was not just a victory for you, but for the entirety of Aethos, ending a deadly and ancient threat from deep within the bowels of this strange, uncertain world.

rootNode.text: A loud screech emanates from the horror in front of you...

children.text: As the final cord snaps, it flails violently around you, trying to latch on to the small isle of your reality that extends into the Spine of Night. But you find your footing first and kick the now helpless pustule of demonic energy over the edge, its screeching sounds following it down into the endless depths below. Whatever this place is, or was - it seems to have relinquished its grip on your world. Not only did you defeat the demon invader who fed on the despair it wrought - you destroyed the very means of their trespassing. Perhaps once and for all, ending the dark occupation of Aethos, and ushering in a new era, with a brighter future for mankind in this strange, vast universe.

For a moment, all hope flees your body as you stare into the abyss, intertwined with thousands of demonic portals leading to deeper and deeper hellscapes. Perhaps this isn't your battle to fight after all. Perhaps it is enough to know your world has been rid of evil and should be vigilant against new invasions. Perhaps - this was the end you were always meant to achieve... As the thoughts keep racing through your mind, the world turns black. Only to be awakened by a somehow familiar sounding voice. "Hail stranger..."

Compassion, a profound empathy that flows from the depths of mortal hearts, is intertwined with the awareness of a shared vulnerability. It is nurtured by the understanding of the ephemeral nature of life, the interconnectedness of all beings, and the recognition of suffering as a universal experience.

Yet, in the realm of immortality, where time knows no boundaries and wounds so easily heal, compassion faces a daunting dilemma. rootNode.text: A young, wounded boar cries out in pain and fear, its hoof trapped by two large iron claws.

children.choiceLabel: Hunter: Kill and skin the animal

children.text: You skin the animal with expert craftsmanship, fashioning yourself an extra layer of padding for your armor.
The wounded animal doesn’t resist as you strike it with a swift blow, putting it out of its misery. It’ll make for a nice roast to sustain you on your journey ahead.
The animal whimpers meekly as you set it free. It awkwardly takes its first few steps as a free animal, leaving a messy trail of blood.
You pour the healing potion into the young animal’s mouth. It resists at first, but as the healing effects take hold, it starts to skip and leap happily around at your feet.
